entry.title: Stowe Gardens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the only woman to feature in the Temple of British Worthies (pictured) at Stowe Gardens is Elizabeth I?

entry.title: Shirley Kurata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shirley Kurata is said to have "subverted and reclaimed Asian-centric tropes" through her "outrageous" costume designs for movie villain Jobu Tupaki?

entry.title: Fountain Fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the time, the Fountain Fire was the third-most destructive wildfire in California's recorded history?

entry.title: Uthmaniyya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Uthmaniyya, the partisans of Uthman, the third Muslim caliph, killed his assassin Kinana ibn Bishr in the First Muslim Civil War?

entry.title: Josiane Lima (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Josiane Lima won Brazil's first Paralympic rowing medal?

entry.title: Caulfield railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Caulfield railway station had a ticket office for the adjacent racecourse and a platform for delivering horses to it?

entry.title: Arnold Archambeau and Ruby Bruguier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that police doubt that Arnold Archambeau and Ruby Bruguier died shortly after a car accident, even though their bodies were found near the scene three months later?

entry.title: Baby! 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Baby! 1 microcomputer came shipped in an attaché briefcase?
